verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
How<WH5704> long<WH5704> will you vex<WH3013> my soul,<WH5315> and break<WH1792> me in pieces with words?<WH4405>
These<WH2088> ten<WH6235> times<WH6471> have you reproached<WH3637> me: you are not ashamed<WH954> that you make yourselves strange<WH1970> to me.
And be it indeed<WH551> that I have erred,<WH7683> my error<WH4879> remains<WH3885> with myself.
If<WH518> indeed<WH551> you will magnify<WH1431> yourselves against<WH5921> me, and plead<WH3198> against<WH5921> me my reproach:<WH2781>
Know<WH3045> now<WH645> that God<WH433> has overthrown<WH5791> me, and has compassed<WH5362> me with his net.<WH4685>
Behold,<WH2005> I cry<WH6817> out of wrong,<WH2555> but I am not heard:<WH6030> I cry<WH7768> aloud,<WH7768> but there is no<WH3808> judgment.<WH4941>
He has fenced<WH1443> up my way<WH734> that I cannot<WH3808> pass,<WH5674> and he has set<WH7760> darkness<WH2822> in my paths.<WH5410>
He has stripped<WH6584> me of my glory,<WH3519> and taken<WH5493> the crown<WH5850> from my head.<WH7218>
He has destroyed<WH5422> me on every<WH5437> side,<WH5439> and I am gone:<WH3212> and my hope<WH8615> has he removed<WH5265> like a tree.<WH6086>
He has also kindled<WH2734> his wrath<WH639> against<WH5921> me, and he counts<WH2803> me to him as one of his enemies.<WH6862>
His troops<WH1416> come<WH935> together,<WH3162> and raise<WH5549> up their way<WH1870> against<WH5921> me, and encamp<WH2583> round<WH5439> about my tabernacle.<WH168>
He has put my brothers<WH251> far<WH7350> from me, and my acquaintance<WH3045> are truly<WH389> estranged<WH2114> from me.
My kinsfolk<WH7138> have failed,<WH2308> and my familiar<WH3045> friends have forgotten<WH7911> me.
They that dwell<WH1481> in my house,<WH1004> and my maids,<WH519> count<WH2803> me for a stranger:<WH2114> I am an alien<WH5237> in their sight.<WH5869>
I called<WH7121> my servant,<WH5650> and he gave me no<WH3808> answer;<WH6030> I entreated<WH2603> him with my mouth.<WH6310>
My breath<WH7307> is strange<WH2114> to my wife,<WH802> though I entreated<WH2589> for the children's<WH1121> sake of my own body.<WH990>
Yes,<WH1571> young children despised<WH3988> me; I arose,<WH6965> and they spoke<WH1696> against me.
All<WH3605> my inward<WH5475> friends<WH4962> abhorred<WH8581> me: and they whom I loved<WH157> are turned<WH2015> against me.
My bone<WH6106> sticks<WH1692> to my skin<WH5785> and to my flesh,<WH1320> and I am escaped<WH4422> with the skin<WH5785> of my teeth.<WH8127>
Have pity<WH2603> on me, have pity<WH2603> on me, O you my friends;<WH7453> for the hand<WH3027> of God<WH433> has touched<WH5060> me.
Why<WH4100> do you persecute<WH7291> me as God,<WH410> and are not satisfied<WH7646> with my flesh?<WH1320>
Oh that my words<WH4405> were now<WH645> written!<WH3789> oh that they were printed<WH2710> in a book!<WH5612>
That they were graven<WH2672> with an iron<WH1270> pen<WH5842> and lead<WH5777> in the rock<WH6697> for ever!<WH5703>
For I know<WH3045> that my redeemer<WH1350> lives,<WH2416> and that he shall stand<WH6965> at the latter<WH314> day on the earth:<WH6083>
And though after<WH310> my skin<WH5785> worms destroy<WH5362> this<WH2063> body, yet in my flesh<WH1320> shall I see<WH2372> God:<WH433>
Whom<WH834> I shall see<WH2372> for myself, and my eyes<WH5869> shall behold,<WH7200> and not another;<WH2114> though my reins<WH3629> be consumed<WH3615> within<WH2436> me.
But you should say,<WH559> Why<WH4100> persecute<WH7291> we him, seeing the root<WH8328> of the matter<WH1697> is found<WH4672> in me?
Be you afraid<WH1481> of the sword:<WH2719> for wrath<WH2534> brings the punishments<WH5771> of the sword,<WH2719> that you may know<WH3045> there is a judgment.<WH1779>
